list_definition.definition: feeling pleasure or satisfaction at one’s achievements, possessions, connections etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He was proud of his new house
She was proud of her son’s achievements
He was proud to play football for the school.

list_definition.definition: having a (too) high opinion of oneself; arrogant

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She was too proud to talk to us.
She was too proud to accept help.
The assembled fleet was a proud sight.

list_ex_of_english: He is extremely proud of the fact that his school boasts the only computer lab of all local primary schools.
Many respondents were proud of having achieved something.
The common law's ability to develop in this way is its proudest boast.
He produced a number of straightforward taxidermy specimens and was proud of their naturalistic appearance.
In this sense, the optimistic discourse of the whole field of neuroscience is interpreted, by its contradictors, as a proud prophetism.
With her proud stance and broad wings, she is the formal and ideological inverse of the sphinx.
The designer must have been justifiably proud of it.
There were also language associations, and proud speakers of particular languages, but rarely did these people hold politically influential positions.
